Front desk did not appear very professional at first, but all our requests were promptly handled.  Phuket center market is on the west side of the Island and one can take a bus from the beach road.  The frequency is every hour until 6 pm, but do check before you make your plans.  We would recommend this hotel to everyone.  Close to the beach, quiet, clean, and walking…

title: Central Location
review: It was indeed delighted to serve both of you during your recent stay with us at the Andaman Embrace. We are also very glad to hear that both of you were happy about our facilities and services as well as the neighboring surroundings that make our hotel in the middle of all conveniences. We are very keen to serve both of you again soon.

title: Excellent location, staff, facilities
review: We booked two rooms through wotif to escape a poor choice of hotel in Karon Beach. The rooms are very bright and clean and look like they have been recently renovated. Air Conditioning worked very well and was not too noisy at night. We had rooms on the 6th floor with views of the ocean.  The hotel is in a central location yet there was very little noise to be heard at night. My only complaint would be, at breakfast the staff would pile up the hot food in the warming dishes, even if there was only a few people at breakfast.  Then the food would be cold; I doubt the warming dishes were even on.   Other than that the pool was big and clean and pleasant to sit around with a drink. The drinks and food were reasonably priced for a hotel.

title: Good stay and relax in this resort~!
review: We sincerely appreciate your kind response regarding our efforts to improve in perfecting our standards. In regards to our breakfast that day it just so happened that was the very morning we catered a group of 170 people. As a result to the high piling of food that you came across as the group left. On behalf of Andaman Embrace Resort & Spa I extend my sincere apologies. To avoid such problems in the future we are allowing more time between schedule events and would like to thank you for you patience and past support.

title: Excellent location & Well kept hotel
review: A friend and I stayed at Andaman Embrace for just over 2 weeks and I can't say one bad thing about the place. It was in the best location, about one street back from Patong Beach and about 15 mins walk to Jung Ceylon shopping mall. The staff are so friendly and nothing is ever a problem - although I think this is more of a Thai trait. The swimming pool is awesome with a swim up bar and it would be great for families as they have a little playroom for kids - in fact I will definitely be back with my hubby & two young children. The rooms were great, free WiFi, although we did have to get a router (hotel supplied) because our signal was too weak, but no problems after this. As far as street noise goes, it wasn't too bad considering the hotel is on a main thoroughfare. Price was…

title: Great location, staff, pool ,breakfast
review: We stayed here in March 2013 and loved it. The staff were so friendly you felt at ease straight away, and nothing was a problem for them, from the girls at reception to the boys  at the pool bar you were always greeted with a huge smile and friendly banter. The rooms were large and comfortable with every thing you need. Breakfast was a fantastic buffet with a great selection of Asian and western food and once again served with a smile. The pool and its surrounds were very refreshing and relaxing. Andamans location is perfect, walking distance to everything(beach, bangla, markets, restaurants ect) but still not so busy and nice and quite. ATM and exchange booths are directly across road with chemists and 7/11s minutes away. We had a great week here and would not hesitate to stay…

title: Decent hotel
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you for choosing Andaman Embrace as your destination of choice here in Phuket.   We are trill to know that our staffs were able to respond to your every request. Your comment will be pass on to our staffs and on their behalf we thank you for a positive feedback and observations.  We certainly look forward to seeing you again whenever your travels bring you back to the city. If our team can be of assistance in helping you book a future reservation with us or assist you in choosing that special accommodation, please do not hesitate to call upon us.  See you soon!!!

title: excellent place near Patong beach
review: Decided to stay in this hotel since it was neither too close to Soi Bangla that we will be disturbed by the noise and crowd and neither was it too far that we can't walk. It's also close to the beach and not too far away from restaurants.  Room was clean and tidy, but the only gripe I had was with the bathroom because when using the shower in the tub the water channels to the side and leaks out causing the floor to be wet and slippery. Otherwise everything else was ok.  There is a big free form pool with bar, which I suspect to be salt water based which makes it easier to swim. There is also a separate section for wadding and quite a few sun loungers.  Room did not come with breakfast so not able to comment.

title: Refurbished and comfortable
review: Dear “Visit_MY"  Thank you very much for your great review and I appreciate you like our resort and our location with just a step away from the beach and a great variety of restaurants all in walking distance.   Please let us know if you get a chance to visit Patong again. We look forward to have you with us again.  Best regards,

title: Spacious , clean and quite
review: The place is nice, good view, friendly staff, nice swimming pool, very near to Patong beach, very close to Paong nightlife places on Bangla road. We stayed here for 3 nights in June 2013. The room was clean, with good view of the pool as well as the beach (beach view is not full).

title: Superb location!
review: Upon arrival, I was served with a refreshing glass of Pandan-flavoured drink, good refreshment after a long flight and the journey to the hotel from the airport. Stayed in the hotel for 3 nights and I really don't have much to complain. Hotel is family-friendly, and the frontdesk staff were friendly and helpful. The pool has a swim-up bar but the poolside area seemed to be understaffed most of the time I was there which makes it a bit frustrating whenever assistance was required. Breakfast spread was okay, decent food and they have egg station, which I think is essential.   I stayed in the balcony deluxe on the 2nd floor. Room is very clean and quite spacious - nothing flashy but not disappointing either. Balcony of my room is also huge, but I wasn't very impressed with the view…

title: Our Short HolidayMoon
review: Dear ElianaAnuar,  Thank you very much for your informative comments. We are sorry to hear that you are not satisfied with our WI-FI. Our WI-FI is at complimentary for every guest rooms and we are trying our best to make sure the internet speed is up to your standard. Wireless router is available on request for room with weak WI-FI signal as well.  We are taking all feedback serious and review our product offering continuously. We are also very delighted to take all of your comments for our much better services.   I look forward to welcome you back to our hotel in the near future. Adison S.

title: Great Breakfast & terrific locations
review: We paid only MYR200 for our room for 3 nights on our short HolidayMoon getaway in Phuket. We would come again with our kids next time. Beautiful Swimming pool. 3 minutes walk to the the Famous Patong Beach. 5 minutes to our Tailor,10 minutes to JunkCeylon malls and 15 minutes to Hard Rock Cafe. The best part is we can rest and I can also keep myself updated with the rest of the world with free broadband wifi in the room. Just in case for room #204, the login is :: 204 and the password is :: VEHI. Thanks. Enjoy the trip!!

title: Great position and good value
review: Dear both,  Thank you for your great review. We are very happy to learn that you enjoyed our great location on the northern beach of Patong. It is indeed more peaceful than the southern part but you have everything you need just around the corner.   Our WI-FI is at complimentary for every guest room and we are trying our best to make sure the internet speed is up to your standard. Wireless router is available on request for room with weak WI-FI signal as well!!  Thanks again for your comments, I am very proud receiving feedback such as yours.   Looking forward to welcome you again in the near future.  Best regards,  Adison S.

title: Best of Phuket!!!
review: This was formely known as Club Andaman Beach Resort. It is situated at the top end of the busy shopping strip. Just a beautiful stroll away from the hustle and bustle. We stayed here in September , the buffet breakfasts were amazing. It had everything you could think of, and catered for all nationalities. The resort is situated amogst beautiful landscaped gardens and two swimming pools. The staff always greeted us with a friendly smile. I would definately stay here again, location is great and breakfast great.

title: Location, Clean & Spacious Rooms
review: Our party of 5 adults & 1 toddler arrived a little earlier ahead of check in time and naturally, had to wait for available rooms as house keeping was in the process of tidying after previous guests. Checking in took about 10 minutes as we had prepaid our stay.   While waiting for an available room we decided to have lunch at the in-house Twigs Restaurant. It was deserted when we were there, about 12:30pm and tables were not yet set. Perhaps lunch traffic is slow, given the many dining options available around town. We were just a little taken aback by one female wait staff's lack of warmth and a slightly grumpy demeanor when we eventually managed to get her attention in the empty dining hall so we could get a comfortable seating arrangement. In consolation, another wait staff…

title: Awesome balcony room and fantastic location!
review: Dear Chel78,  Your informative comments are truly of good value. We do apologize for disappointing your lunch experience with such a poor welcome by our services attendant. We shall seriously keep on improvement particularly for our staff etiquette and attentiveness. In the meantime, we thank for your compliments on the positive services of our young lady at the Concierge. Her name is ‘Fun’. Please rest assured that we shall encourage her as one of our qualified staff to maintain good standard of services in pursuit of excellence.  Best regards,

title: Great location
review: I just love this hotel, mostly because of its hotel room amenities and have a really big room. I just stayed for 1 person just because it was last minutes holiday. Room is overlooking the swimming pool and slight view of the Patong beach. Really enjoyed the sun set from the balcony. The only thing I have to mentioned is the reception did not refund my deposit upon my checkout until am back in Singapore and luckily my friend were still there to collect on behalf. It was sorted out quickly by the Front office team. Kudos! But, perhaps they could be more attentive on this matter.  Anyway, looking forward to stay at this resort very soon. Thank you.

title: Great service
review: Auermann, Thank you very much for your valued comments and recommendation and please accept our sincere apology for such inefficient checkout process. We’ll try our best to improve our standard of services and we do wish to welcome you back in the near future.

title: Great Hotel, Clean, Comfortable and Great Location.
review: The best part about the property was its location. It is just a minutes walk from the beach. And then just another couple of minutes from the main drag where you can pick a different place to eat your lunch and dinner every single day.The hotel itself is clean and well kept. Breakfast served at the Twigs Restaurant was wonderful and the variety and freshness of the spread made me look forward to it every morning. The ambience was super as this restaurant had no walls on three sides. This place is very child friendly so it's really great for families. There is a small kids club and the pool has 3-4 sections for every age and profiency of swimmers. I will definitely be returning.

title: Good value good location
review: I had a balcony room and yes there is no shade and can be very hot but the room itself was clean and had a very good bed. The bath room was also quiet new the shower worked a treat  although the open shower meant water went every where not really a problem as it is the bathroom the pool side service was slim, expensive and unable to communicate very well ton my bar man was great. Yes they do charge quiet high for damage but as k81manchester said they had 4 room broke 3 glasses if every one did this the rooms would cost more to account for the clumsiness and it would not be as good of value. I found that the fact they will still service your room after 1pm a delight as I am here on a boys trip.  The down side the breakfast to be a let down great variety and good service but no…

title: IzzyCheshire
review: Thank you very much for your informative comments on our hotel facilities and services. We are more than happy to take your advices for our better services. We look forward to having chance to welcome you and your family again in the future.

title: Ok
review: Some aspects of our stay were very good, however, there were also negatives.  On arrival we were advised that the hotel policy was to hold 500 bahts per room per night and as we were staying for 10 nights they would require us to pay 5000 baths deposit for each room ( there were 8 of us therefore we had 4 rooms).  I advised that we had not been informed of this prior to arrival and would not be happy to pay 5000 baht however, we willing gave our credit card details as a guarantee which was accepted but didnt stop the staff from emptying our room fridges. The breakfast was very good and the hotel reception staff extremely helpful and friendly.  The rooms are quite spacious and the beds very comfortable. I dropped a glass which was just a plain bathroom glass and the hotel charged…

title: There are better hotels around Patong Beach
review: Stayed here for 7 nights Feb 13. The hotel Has recently been upgraded and there were many tour groups coming and going each day which made it quite noisy at times.    We purchased a groupon voucher for deluxe room but opted to pay $50aud per night extra for balcony deluxe. The balcony rooms have no shade or weather protection whatsoever with the slant design of the roofs and we actually purchased some rope and a tarp and created some shade for ourselves, so in hindsight would not pay to upgrade in future as without some form of shade and rain protection the balcony is virtually useless as too hot or wet during the day. Room itself was ok, nothing flash but nothing horrible. No clocks in room though, so if you are like me and not using phone or computer or wearing a watch on…

title: Beautiful clean, modern hotel within walking distance to everything
review: We stayed in a Deluxe Balcony Room over Christmas 2012 and weren't overly impressed, especially for the prices charged. The room itself was average, have stayed in alot cheaper hotels where the rooms were similar, if not better for half the price. The hot and cold in the shower kept changing every 15-20 seconds so it was either cold or boiling hot. The pool area was still under construction and the swim up bar was not operational (nothing about this on their website or thru the booking agency we used). It was also very hard to get a drink by the pool as there were no staff around so had to go up to the lobby bar and get drinks ourselves. On a positive note, the breakfast was great with alot of variety and the location of the hotel excellent with everything within close walking…

title: Comfortable & Wonderful Hotel & Staff
review: My friends and I stayed in Andaman from 20-23 Dec 2012 and it was a great experience.  My friends and I went for the Andaman Deluxe with breakfast option. Breakfast buffet menu changes daily, providing variety. Love the swimming pool where my friends and I could swim not only in the morning but also at night & I'm sure some folks would love to have a drink by the swimming pool since there is a mini-bar in the middle. The bedroom was spacious and the bed was comfy. Hotel staff were friendly and met our expectations. We requested for hotel pick-up to & fro from the airport and it was arranged. The pick up happened to be one of the hotel staff and even briefed us on Phuket for 1st timers like us while we were on the way to the hotel.  It was no trouble finding seafood places to…

title: Very new and clean hotel
review: Very friendly, English speaking staff at the reception. Overall a very nice clean hotel, near to the beach, eating places and massage parlours in abundance nearby. The only minor complain I have is the water pressure. Every 30 seconds or so the cold water pressure will drop significantly for about 5 seconds then go back up again. Makes for a rather uncomfortable shower experience.  Hope they'll fix that.  Stayed in Dec 2012 and there was some party/concert going on nearby till about 12-1am and you can hear music blasting. So if you're sensitive to that make sure you request for rooms that are NOT facing the beach.

title: Grounds depleted
review: I will preface this review by saying that I have stayed at Club Andaman many years ago when it was just thatched cottages with beautiful grounds and swimming pools.  Then came the high rise but still retained the cottages/grounds and walk over the road to the beach. For old times sake I visited the property again just last week to see what the renovations had achieved and was horrified.  (I did not see inside any rooms so I cannot comment on them).  All the grounds near the beach containing the cottages, grassed areas, gardens and swimming pools are gone to be replaced with builiding site of a multi storey hotel painted a hideous purple colour. There is a new smallish pool on the north side of the restaurant.  The restaurant is still the same and the newer cottages on the south…

title: Wonderful
review: We visited the hotel in NOv 2012. the receptionist were fabulous . there is the front office manager , i think his name was Matt , he is an English gentleman he was soo helpful. First we booked a superior room and then we moved to the cottage .  Service is quick , rooms are wonderful clean , its far away compared to 4 star hotels in KL or singapore , its better by miles.  The receptionist are always smiling, we called the engineering twice and they came in less than 5 minutes , actuall we had problem with the flush . When they couldnt solve the issue they offered us a suite!!  well we loved the cottage and preffered to take another cottage .  my flight was at 12 midnight and i asked to extend my checkout till 8 PM , the manager offered me to pay 100$ as extra charge , 1/2 day…

title: Good and happy 4 night stay
review: Hotel is new ,good and clean. Rooms are spacious. I got a free upgrade from Deluxe to Balcony.  Hotel staff is very courteous and most of them can speak good English. Though its not located right at the centre of bustling patong beach but its just few mins away. Hotel tour agent was very helpful in arranging our trips and even went beyond her call of duty to reverify the prices to get us a discount. SPA is not ready yet but they arranged for another one nearby with free pickup and drop. Swimming pool is 90% ready (shower area still under construction and kids pool was closed almost all days for "maintenance"). Ordering food from room was bit of a challenge as the person on other side didn't understand English well  and in the end it got mixed up. Takenote, call the receptionist…

title: Renovation not finished yet, but already functioning. Great Location
review: Well. stayed there for 3 nights - and I did enjoy it. The hotel has undergone a major renovation, unfortunately the contractors did not stick to their time schedule, i.e. upon arrival only the second floor was operational. Three nights later the third floor also opened for operation. However, since it is considered a new beginning, we were the only two guests in the first night - but thereafter more guests arrived. In general, the pool is only half ready but can be used. The Spa seems also to be late - but the restaurant is fully functioning, at least for breakfast. The breakfast spread was not up to standard yet, but will be improved immediately - at least a superb coffee is served for breakfast and that makes some good for the lack of food variety the first few days. The room…

title: Just accross Patong Beach!
review: This is a late review, we stayed here last 2008.  It's a 4-star hotel and i must say it has been a pleasant stay with them. The amenities are of the 5-star hotel standard and I love their pool! The staff are very accomodating, very polite, and very helpful. They helped me to call Singapore Changi Airport to locate my lost wallet by calling it for me (even if we are unlucky to find it).  The breakfast buffet is superb, lots of choices. It has performers also while you are dining :) The rooms are of course 5-star quality too. The hotel is along Beach Road so the beach is just across the street and best is, it’s just few step away from the famous night spot of Patong, the Bangla Road! So there’s no need to take tuktuk after the shopping and night out!

title: Nice relaxing stay
review: We went to Phuket for the first time and stayed at the then Andaman Beach Resort. We were so excited and so much in love as this was our second trip as a loving couple. This resort is a hidden paradise, right across the road from the quiet end of Patong Beach. Staff at the hotel were all so polite and eager to please.   The room was big and the bed quite comfortable. The hotel looked a bit dated but we were so much engrossed in each other to even notice. One thing to note is that the resort is very close to restaurants which play quite loud music at night which can be annoying if you are after a quiet, relaxing night in. Fortunately our room was located at the distant end.  The pool and luscious tropical grounds are absolutely stunning. Breakfast is fantastic with lots of…

title: Hotel Construction Still Significant Short of Guest Ready
review: Our recent experience was not anywhere what we wanted it to be due to the late cancellation placed upon us by the hotel. That said management at the hotel made contact with us & met with us in Patong to discuss the problem which I felt was a positive action on their part. They shared the difficulties they have been having with the construction company meeting their deadlines & gave us a tour of the site explaining the issues & their plans to get all sorted & up & running. Their time & effort was appreciated. Still there is considerable work needed to make the hotel guest ready.

title: Hotel Still Taking Bookings - Not Ready
review: We like a previous review found the hotel still taking reservations but nowhere near ready to accommodate guests. Booking was accepted around Feb/Mar 2012, I read the previous review so was concerned & emailed my service provider for hotel booking but more importantly the hotel itself on the 10th June 2012 for reassurances they are up & running to meet their obligations, reassurances were given for our 28/6/12 booking. 23/6/12 we were advised by hotel they could not accommodate us which I found extremely bad service given their earlier reassurance. Went & checked it out on arrival 29/6/12 my birthday by the way & the hotel is still nowhere ready so I feel they falsely represent the status to our detriment causing us stress & anxiety trying to find new hotel with such short…

title: Hotel cancels our reservation at last minute
review: My family and I have stayed at the hotel several times before and noted that the hotel was undergoing a rennovation 2011 to early 2012.  We emailed the hotel in January 2012 to enquire when the hotel was going to reopen.  We were advised uncatgorically that the hotel was going to definately be finished and open for business early March 2012, we questioned the completion date several times again via email and each time were advised the hotel would be open for guests early March 2012.  We subsequently booked our accomodation early February 2012 for our wedding anniversary in April 2012.  This week, 8 days before we were to arrive at the hotel we got an email stating the hotel management had cancelled our reservation as the hotels rennovation was not completed.  They apoligised for…

title: Club Andaman closed
review: Unfortunately, we have also been suffering from our uncontrolled delay of the renovation which has caused loss of business over 4 - 5 months. Anyway, we do accept your comments and find no single reason for any objection to such unintended incident having spoiled your wedding anniversary trip. We are just expecting your kind understanding as well as to be one of your alternative hotels for the next visit. We are also pleased to inform that our new opening month is expected to be in June 2012.

title: life to enjoy
review: We have stayed here three times in the past and thoroughly enjoyed the hotel.  Club Andaman is no longer accepting bookings as it closed on April 30, 2011.  During our last visit to Patong in May we had a look around the grounds.  The two pools are empty and the gardens untended.  There is a security guard at the entrance and workers in the main building.  We understand the hotel will reopen under a new name and management in December 2011.

title: Beautiful resort and good location...
review: The visit to Phuket was a memorable one. The hotel is quite attractive, comfortable, exotic and have a very decent staff who are very responsive and eager to serve. The bar and restaurant have a good ambience and very close to the swimming pool which adds to its beauty. The beach is hardly 5 min. walk and is peaceful as well as attractive. The rooms are very spacious, hygenic and well kept. We recommend this hotel to the incoming tourists for their pleasant encounter with nature.

title: Needs upgrading
review: We spent 5 nights in this resort in a cottage. It was just ok, room was clean and spacious. Though our "double bed" was actually 2 twin beds standing together and with double bed linen for  on it. Also the resort is full of cats and one of them decided to have rest on our towels that we left outside to dry. Breakfast was fine (eggs, bacon, yummy pastries and flavoured breads, thai soups), but..... they had no oatmeat, and that was sad. I think next time we go to Patong we won't get included breakfast because the city offers cheap delicious meals at every corner and paying $10-15 for hotel breakfast is waste of money. Resort area was very nice though we never spent time there, because beach was literary 2 steps away. Hotel stuff was helpful and polite, but there was one strange…

title: Don't stay here, you will be robbed!
review: A warning to all felow travellers. The pics on the net for this hotel look fantastic but it is far from the reality. A large hotel which hasn't been remodeled since King Tut days failed dismally to deliver the lovely relaxing time that my partner and I were after.Set in luscious gardens, they should pay more attention to the old and worn out inside. There is no service whatsoever, it takes 1/2 hour to get towels brought up, bad luck if you need toilet paper.. that took 3/4 hour...isnt the de luxe room supossed to be equipped with towels and toilet paper?? The shower didnt work, we moved to another room where we came back later to find that money had been taken from the safe....robbed from the room safe...we could not believe it! Their attitude was, the insurance will cover…

title: Not worth it
review: Other hotel give free wifi. This hotel charge 150 bath per hour. Not cool.   Everytime we came back from tours, u have to call housekeeping for towels. They will make your bed, take away the used towel but won't replace. Have to call to get one back.   We stay at 2nd flr, our room were blocked by trees. Not nice.   Conclusion. Should have stay in a cheaper hotel nearby the beach

title: 10 reasons not to stay here
review: I noticed the recenct reviews are the worst. I regret not reading these reviews more before booking this hotel and spending 4 nights here.  1.  Rooms are very outdated.  TV is from the 1980's along with just about everything else.   2.  Service is bad.  We were happy with the service everywhere else in Thailand except for this place.    3.  No towels in the bathroom when we got there and it was a hassle to get room service to bring them up. 4. Tried to cancel remaing 3 days after spending one night there.  Girl working the front desk said that was ok to cancel the last 2 nights, but when our travel agency called to cancel manager answered the phone and told them differently.  She said we could only cancel the last night and would be penalized a night without stay for cancelling.…

title: definitely not a 4 star hotel
review: Its rather 2-3 stars hotel. The furniture was old, the bathroom was extremely old and not maintained. Breakfast was OK. Check-in/out staff quite slow. I cant really blame the hotel for the huge cockroach in our bungalow, but have it in mind if you go for a cottage. Also some of them are really bad positioned among the other cottages without much sunlight in them. Luckily we were in front bungalow facing the pool. Pool and breakfast staff were OK.  The good thing are the location - few meters from the beach and beach road. And the garden as well.  We were there for New Year holidays - NY Gala Dinner was too expensive so we skipped it and went to the beach.  In general i wouldnt recommend this hotel for this price.

title: Avoid this one....
review: I stayed in this hotel 6-7 years ago, and can say they have not spent a cent upgrading anything in this hotel.   They have obviously paid someone off to get the 4 star rating because there is NO way this is a 4 star hotel. I would say it is a 2 star maybe 3 at a stretch. So if you are looking for a 2 star hotel this will be fine.   Facilities very old, service across the board very average. One of the travelling party who had their own room had their room rate reduced by nearly half because they were Thai and in the words of the reception staff "They are Thai people so they get Thai price"... oh well at least they were honest .. kinda :-)   The rooms are very very average, I had a clanky air-con unit that kept me awake the first night, but was fixed the next day however the…

title: Wonderful place to stay
review: We were a family of 5 adults and we booked adjoining cottage/bungalows.  Rooms were more than comfortable and well maintained.  Club Andaman is perfectly situated and extremely close to the beach.  Communication with the staff is a little difficult at times but they are a humble people and a little friendliness from foreign visitors is needed.  The cottages are very private and well equipped and are perfectly situated for a short walk to the pool. The noise levels were a bit extreme for people wanting to get an early night as there was a music festival two roads down every night till 2pm.  Restaurants in the area are really great and exceptionally well priced, we found a perfect Italian restaurant around the corner and the Danish restaurant (near Andaman beach suites) was also…

title: avoid it...
review: ..30 years ago I think this hotel got 4 stars. They just make money, but didn't invest in the meanwhyle. Dirty carpets, old fashion rooms, dodgey plumbing...The pool attendant service and pool facilities were poor. Staff at the reception for check in/check out was ok. Bell boy had just other interest then to find a taxi. Food was so so....the steak was overdone, staff nice, but slow. restaurant like a rail station hall, just a food hall..... Business center?? whats this... Garden is fine.. with location the only positive. I think they pay now for to get 4 stars...smile  Avoid this hotel, except you need it just for one night to check in somewhere else  ( as I had to do...)

title: Recommend you stay here
review: We stayed in this Hotel, which is on Patong beach & is located just off the beach. We enjoyed the stay here & there are optional activities for all age groups. They serve a very good buffet breakfast in a good location. We enjoyed the stay & intend to go back again. The only problem that we found was in the extremely noisy outdoor music which would literally lead to a numbing experience. They could have gone for better sound proofing. However I would recommend this hotel as a good stay with value for money.

title: Service pretty average
review: When we first arrived at the hotel, for some reason the website we booked through had not passed the details on and there were not rooms ready for us. Fair enough, but it ended up taking about 40 mins to sort it out which was tiring and a bit frustrating given it was not peak season. The breakfast buffet is pretty good and probably the most positive and memorable experience from the hotel. On my last day, I needed to organise to get a taxi to the local bus station and the woman at the travel desk admitted not knowing the bus timetable which was fine, but did not offer to call the bus company to find out, giving fairly imprecise advise buses to Khao Lak. I to just  "be ready at 9am and she would call a cab get to go to the bus station and then I should ask at the bus station…

title: Relaxing Atmosphere
review: I found this resort with its large landscaped gardens, facilities, activities and friendly staff an ideal place to get away and relax. The service and the location of this hotel was good. You can walk to the beach in a couple of minutes, and to get to the main nightlife is only a   10 minute casual walk. Choice  of ATMs, money exchange, deli and restaurants are close. If you need to do laundry and prefer to save money, there is a laundry just across the road with same day service.

title: Outside busy, Inside calm. you can get both of them..
review: It's a little bit old hotel. But it is located in middle of Patong street and possess  wide area. Outside hotel, you can enjoy crowded street and cheap food, massage easily. Inside hotel, It's really calm and peaceful. so you can rest full enough.  We brought two young daughters(1 & 3 years old). so location of hotel was very important to us.  this hotel was the best choice we can.  I want to recommend this hotel for family who travels with babies but wants to enjoy exotic circumstance from time to time.

title: brillant hotel dont know what will happen when lease runs out
review: a very good hotel the third time i have been here, food location rooms and view and gardens and beach are second to none but sunbeads are old and needs replacing and so do beach towels, and man by the swimming pool doesnt even smile and everything is a hassle for him having said that i understand now that the hotel is up on its lease and a new owner will be allocated and I dont know what will happen to the hotel as its the only hotel i know with lots of lovely gardens and view and it might be sold off in april 2011 or maybe too expensive when the lease runs out, and its built on or even worse, people we spoke with have been coming back here for years and we are a small club of people who return time and time again so will wait and see   yes go here you will not be disppointed.

title: Good for 4* beach hotel
review: Just across the road from Patong beach with sea sports. Near to Bangla Road nightlife and numerous shops. Cheap Kinaree massage spa in front right of hotel entrance. Next to spa is cheap lobster and seafood Sun Restaurant. Very good breakfast and swimming pools.

title: Friendly and helpful staff, and excellent resort
review: We have just returned from 8 nights at the Club Andaman Beach Resort, Patong Beach.   We found the the staff at Club Andaman to be most helpful and friendly.  Nothing was too much trouble.    Enjoyed a beautiful buffet breakfast every morning, and also ate at the Resort restaurant on a couple of occasions - great food and excellent service.    As we were travelling with our 19yo and 23yo daughters we chose to book the Royal Suite.   This proved to be a good decision, as we all had plenty of room (2 huge bedrooms, plus living area, and three bathrooms and a large balcony).    The pool areas are spacious, and the pool bar and restaurant is an added bonus.    The resort itself is set in and amongst beautiful spacious gardens and we found that although Club Andaman is positioned…

title: Nice exteriör, but rooms and management definately not 4-star!
review: Don´t get carried away buy the garden pictures and location. Rooms were noisy, had a damp smell and had to be shared with bathroom ants. Room sevice wil forget your order if you don´t remind them. Airporttaxi service overpriced and late. Don´t bother to book an eariler departure it wont work! Reception desk staff will not understand (what ever the language you speak) if you have a complaint, and management will be rude. If you want to experiance thai hospitality and politeness, than stay away from this hotel.

title: a good 4 star hotel
review: Having read all the negative critics I was prepared for the worse, but the hotel was quite nice! Clean, cozy, nice pools, next to the Kalim beach, at the very heart of Phuket! the staff was really nice. Excellent breakfast, nice bars! Would definitely go there again!!!

title: better than expected
review: After reading previous reviews, we were not sure of what to expect,but when we arrived at this resort we found that  it was far better than what we had expected. The resort was in a good location, it was very clean,the rooms were wonderful, our room ( anadman delux ) had the biggest bed ever, the views were great. staff very friendly, NO hassles, pool was a little old but you realy could not tell.  For this time of year there were not to many people around, so you could stil get  a pool lounge chair at 10.00  in the morning. To get to the beach, just walk accross the road, easy, The resort breakfast could not be faulted, the gardens were very well maintained and a pleasure to walk around. All the shopping and eating you would want to do is an easy 5 min walk away. WE have stayed…

title: Ideal location and facilities
review: As seniors our party of 4 stayed in this hotel for our first stay in Phuket.  We were treated with respect and courtesy at all times and servicing of our room could not be faulted.  The restaurant had all we could eat except Asia has no fresh milk. You get used to reconstituted milk.  The hotel backs onto the main road by the beach and via the pool rear access you can visit the mini mart at the rear of the hotel for all your needs.  A Coffe World is nearby for that extra coffee taste and an Irish Pub is about 50 metres away.  Bangla Road is only about 10 minutes walk .  The hotel's extensive gardens were a pleasure to look at and kept well.  There is a kid's club by the pool area and a great feature was the walk in pool rather than diving off the edges.  Would stay here again…

title: Still a great place to stay
review: this is  lovely resort with views that can't be beaten. If you are looking for a tropical paridise this is it. the rooms are no longer as great as they were but the enviroment remains top of my list. Breakfast never let us down and the snack bar was adequate.The pool area does need upgrading as far as the seating goes but the pool itself was clean and well cared for. There are no longer the theme nights of the past but I guess that is due to the fact that a 10 minute walk takes you to the hub of all that is nightlife and the restuarants are all you would expect to find.The beach is cleaned each morning and the surf was great. even though it was ithe rainy season this in no way spoiled our trip. We have traveled in this area before and will do so again. We found the staff helpful…

title: Great resort, will be back again!
review: My wife and I visited this resort during our 5th wedding anniversary and found that the resort is really nice and easy access to the beach, shopping mall, etc.. We will be back again in the future.

title: Good Hotel with nice pools
review: Stayed here for 5 days then returned later after Koh Samui for another 5 days.  Do not book the cottage villas as they are a dive?.  Old, damp, dark and shocking.  I thought having young kids with us the cottages would be good near the pool away from the main towers.  I was wrong and found other people did the sasme.  Luckily it was quite and I upgraded at no cost to Andaman deluxe rooms x 2 interconnecting for the entire stay.  Very nice with no balcony which we wanted due to kids.  Hotel is nice, gardens, 2 x pools very large and good.  Breakfast is good.  Hotel staff are very friendly and love the young kids.  Happy hour changed couple of times, drinks ok but not strong as we have back in Aust.  I would stay there again this time without young kids.  Only 5 mins to walk to…

title: 4 day get a way
review: a few of us went for a few dats get away with a 2 year old child. we live in Hong Kong and so this really was just a quick boking for easter break and some time away to chillax. 3 friends and a baby. the room was enouth for us all and clean the only problem we would say we had was every day having to call reseption for clean or new towels afer they had been removed from the room. howerver the staff where very elpfull and so kide to the yng baby could not help enoughAs we had a baby we did not sample the full night life but had a great time we where there for relaxation really, although when ever we were out of the hotel there where pople falling over them selves to help with the baby who had a  great time.  we went to the zoo which was not great but had a good day and had our…

title: Good Place
review: Overall our stay at Club Andaman was very good. The staff at reception was very helpful when we arrived. Had a fairly quick check-in. We had booked a Balcony Deluxe room. They gave us a room on the 3rd floor-I think #302. We were very happy until my daughter found a spider on her pillow. Turned out to be a big bed bug. I took the pillow out of the room & checked- there were 2 more big ones & 2 baby ones. Shook them off & went to sleep. Morning we found almost 10 of them crawling all over the bed & many tiny ones dotting the pillows. It was awful. We called the staff & asked to move to a different room. They only had one on the 5th floor without balcony. This room was smaller but clean-thankfully no more bed bugs. Other than this bad start, the rest of our stay was very…

title: They accused us of not paying our pre-paid inclusions then called the police
review: We pre-booked with Wotif and the room included a pre-paid compulsory dinner for NYE. (which our documentation showed).  Wotif were no help either.  After over an hour of trying to reason with the office staff that we had paid the bill they called the Police who then followed us around Patong, and was very scary.   We were forced to pay for the dinner despite the fact our documentation clearly showed it was included in the package.   The rooms were not nearly as nice as in the photographs but the pool area was fantastic so that was at least something good.

title: Nice Hotel and Beautiful Gardens
review: Stayed here for 15 nights,room was clean and comfortable,we did have to move rooms because the other room was noisy from renovations going on next door. They moved us to same room on different floor,room was exactly as what was pictured on the website. Breakfast was good,and always fresh. Service was great and staff were lovely. Pool area was beautiful,they have 2 pools. Beautiful Gardens,very large and great to walk around. Hotel is close to everything and is in a good location. We will stay again

title: Nice Hotel, shame about the Pool!
review: No doubt that the Andaman is a nice hotel, have stayed there before. Excellent gardens, nice breakfast, good location. I won't be returning to the Andaman for one reason, THE POOL AREA IS A DISGRACE. The staff are extremely rude. The sun beds are looked like they have been retrieved from a tip as they are dirty, broken and decrepid, but that is not the main reason I will not be coming back. They have a ridiculous one towel per person a day policy, so everyone gets up early in the morning and puts a towel on a sun bed in case they decide to go for  swim, consequently all sun beds are reserved by 8am every morning; you can still get a towel but you have to sit on the grass. The pool itself was not cleaned once during our stay; ther were scum lines all around the water edge and…

title: Appalling Service - Would not recommend at all
review: I booked this hotel for the Easter period for my daughter and I. We had stayed at this Hotel back in 2003 and had no problems at all. This was certainly not the case this time. We booked and paid on Wotif.com and received confirmation of our payment and room. Upon arrival at the Hotel we were informed that they were fully booked and we would be transfered to another hotel for 2 nights. We protested but to no avail. The second hotel was cheaper in cost and located in a dirty part of town. Upon return to Club Andaman were were given a free dinner to compensate only to be told once we took up the offer - that the dinner was a pre-set menu of 3 choices and not the full menu.  We spoke to a number of guests at Club Andaman and found that we were not the only customers shifted to the…

title: Excellent!!!
review: Just returned back from Club Andaman, and what an experience it was. I was a bit sceptical as many of the reviews were bad...but i was pleasantly surprised. Firstly, when you are in Phuket you dont want a modern villa with are modern things as you want to get the feel for being in a Thai country. Club Andaman does just that.  Check in was good, no hassles, our room was nice and big (Balcony Deluxe), the bed was huge the bathroom fabulous. The hotel's location is perfect, in a quieter area as well as in walking distance to all the entertainment. Beach is less that 5 mins away, which is fabulous. Pool area great, but do get there early to get your beach chairs. Breakfast a variety...everything you can think of....even bread pudding...can you belive that, lol. Could not fault it at…

title: Go somewhere else !
review: Having stayed at patong beach hotel the last 4 times i have been to phuket ,this hotel was recommend by freinds. So my family decided to make the change so we thought we did the right thing and looked on the internet. Mistake number 1, the rooms looked fantastic but were very old and looked run down. There was 20 people in our group and not one person said they would return, as the sevice was terrible. We stayed in a balcony deluxe room there was no deluxe there. One couple arrived 2 days after everyone else and had a standard room and woke the first day with blood spots on their sheets, they thought they had cut themselves. No cuts were found ,but on investgation found bed lice under the sheets.

title: Great Hotel for Leisure with Kids
review: Am just back from Phuket with my family members (8 adults and 3 kids) for 4 days 3 nights staying at Club Andaman Beach Resort.   The reasons I give "Excellent" for this resort are:  1) Service:  Even this is the 3 1/2 star resort but they give us 5 star service. Example; as I requested high floor rooms. 1st room with baby cot, 2nd & 3rd room with 2 beds and the 4th room with king size bed. To my surprised they are prepared all my above requested according my requested. I had stayed in many countries with 5 start hotel, but on even one hotel they are prepared 100% according to my requested. That’s why I felt surprised..... Normally those 5 star hotels that I had been visited, upon reaching, I might need to request and remind again and again the hotel staffs to provide me the…

title: very average
review: bad start we paid for balcony rooms which were not available we got them after 3 days hotel in general was not bad the letdown was the pool area, very old and dirty sunbeds service from the poolside was a disgrace your table was left to ants and flies all day and there policy of 1 towel per day even if you swim early morning you are advised to leave the wet towel on your sunbed all day, very unfair for other guest, i would say it was a 1star pool area

title: A nice place to stay in Phuket
review: My wife and I stayed 9 nights at the hotel, and enjoyed the relaxed mood of the location. The bed was a super king, however it was very hard and uncomfortable and the air con was very noisy. We told the staff of the problems and the air con was fixed immediately and a support / blankets, were put on the mattress to make it a little more comfortable, The room was serviced daily by very friedly staff who gave us extra bottled water on request at no charge. The location is 100m from the beach, as is the main street and close to all shops and cafes. The daily breakfasts had a great selection as did the evening meal. there was a band playing in the lobby bar each night and a happy hour. Overall it was an enjoyable stay in a pleasant resort.

title: First trip to Thailand made memorable at Club Andaman
review: The highlight of our stay at Club Andaman was our favourite pool boy! He was at our beckon call the entire stay with food and drinks by the pool nearly every day. With a reasonable tip (which was huge to him) the boys had consistent delivery of beer every half hour without delay or request!  We visited with another couple, so had plenty of alone time in the fab restaurant which offers the best breakfast we experienced out of three locations in Thailand, and we had plenty of fun as a group or girls time and boys time.   Our room was not as amazing as another couple of friends (who stayed elsewhere and were paying almost double what we were) but we found the rooms very large, clean, very comfy beds, free bottled water daily and friendly helpful housekeeping staff (who made our…

title: very nice staff
review: even some says this hotel a bit old but to me they offer great services. the staff all friendly. the allowed us to check in early, FOC ok? very2 helpful. in fact we they sent us to airport (i got free airport transfer) i still can request to stop buy at some place to buy last minute souvenir. no charge. we only gave tips to the driver. they also replied our email when we need to confirm the date & airport transfer.  food i think ok. only the hotel not a walking distance to the happening area especially on the 3rd day we already tired to walk :) but hey you can rent motorbikes with good rate right.  overall i have a pleasant stay there

title: Beautiful Garden, Perfect Location
review: If your looking for a place were you can have both adventure and quality time with your friends, I find Club Andaman a perfect place. The location is perfect. two minutes walk to the beach and located between two popular street in Patong. 10 minutes walk to disco area (Bangela Road). The Garden is decorated amazingly. bottom line, it's a value for money hotel. The staff were really friendly and they were always helpful and polite. I recommend you to get the top floor rooms since the lower levels are a bit old and cleanliness is not as expected, although we had a little problem with cleanliness.

title: Terrible Experience, Stay Away
review: I had a guaranteed booking in Andaman Cottage from 13th to 17th Feb 2010. To my horror, on reaching the resort, I was told that all cottages are full and they have made alternative arrangements in a nearby hotel (Blue Marine), which turned out to be some 2 Km away. It was a nasty experience - I shouted at the staff at reception for a few minutes, but not of any use. I had to stay in a different hotel for 2 days, something I had not bargained for and moved into my booked room for the remaining 2 nights. A hotel that cannot honour a booking shoudnt be in the business - avoid this completely unprofessional place.

title: Loved it! We got what we paid for with the bonus of a superb setting!
review: We read as many reviews as possible before we booked and there are many mixed reviews so we tried to keep open minds. The hotel is a little bit dated but not to the point that it bothered us or caused an issue. Our room was an entry level room and we were very surprised by how big it was (we had a room on the 7th floor). The gardens are just people as people have reviewed - beautiful! really lovely with soft grass and very very VERY inviting swimming pools!! At first the beach look a little walk away but you quickly learn that you just have to cut through the hotel gardens and it's literally a road away! The hotel is in a very convenient location - close to the shops and Club Lime and of course all the little bars on the beach.  Breakfast is great - a wide variety and lots of…

title: Stayed a couple of times, will be back for sure
review: I have stayed at this resort on a couple of occasions, first time with my husband and next with friends and have found it to be a great place, we stayed in a balcony dlx room (601&401) both had great view and a nice comfortable room, the staff where great always trying to please and the breakfast spread was wonderful a big selection to choose from plus we did eat dinner there plus room service a few time and enjoyed it, the location is in a good spot not far from everything, will definately stay there again. If anyone would want more info just let me know would be happy to help.

title: Find somewhere else to stay
review: Arrived at this hoteland porter's were efficient and welcoming. A good start I thought. Had to wait 15 minutes before reception staff had time to attend to us. Finally booked in and to ensure we had balcony room I enquired re this to be told that no we did not have balcony room. As I had paid extra for this I requested a balcony only to be told there was none available so shown to room that stank of smoke. Reservation clearly stated non smoking. Declined this room to be shown another poky little room which we also declined. We were then taken to a villa suite which was in beautiful setting but old and depressing. Could not walk bare foot  on floor as it was so dirty, peeling paint from ceiling dropped onto face while in bed and just generally unclean. Asked to speak to general…

title: Paradise in Patong
review: I stayed in this hotel for 7 days with teenage daughter and a 10yr old son.  We absolutelly loved it - from nice clean room, amazing restaurant, two pools (one warm and shallow one deep and cool), lounge chairs (tip - get early to secure your chair), tennis courts, billiard, gym, tropical lush gardens.  The food was great, lots of choices for breakfast.  Even if they served burnt toast in that wonderful semi-open restaurant I would love it!  Went for facial in hotel - recommend it.  The staff was so kind and smiling that made us so feel special and welcome!  Beach is just across the road and the view from some rooms great, from others OK.  Just one note - our initial room had strong cigarette smell so we asked to be transferred to non-smoking room.  We were assured that our room…

title: Excellent service in a great hotel
review: We thorougly enjoyed our week at Club Andaman Beach Resort. Kids had a great time. They had a seperate room just down the hallway. Located across the road from the beach and a block or two from the main noisy bar area of town. Very clean pool with nice outdoor restaurant for the lazy days.

title: Good hotel
review: Our stay in the hotel was very pleasant, Staff tries to help very much; Hotel is very close to the beautiful Patong beach through the back entrance. Pools are goods. Garden is very nice. Food is excellent. Wireless internet is catastrophe. You have to go out to the corroder to work. (Reason for tow points in rate) Across the road to the hotel entrance there is a travel agency (Adaman Relax Tour). Very pleasant and tours and travel cost to the airport are much better than those in the hotel

title: Nice hotel but careful if you want to entertain
review: Nice hotel, nice facilities, overstaffed, which is reflected in the overpriced services e.g. $40 for a bottle of wine. Nice pools, just across the road from very nice (Patong) beach. But beware if you're an "adventurous" traveller. Twice when I came back to the hotel in the evening there was commotion in the foyer when 2 male hotel guests wanted to take a  vistor back to their room, for perhaps  commercial services, not sure. One a Thai girl, one a Thai boy. Anyway the hotel, to the men's chagrin, demanded that the visitor hand over ID to be kept until they leave and the hotel guest has to pay a $50 fee. I wonder if the word pimping means anything to the hotel owners. Very humiliating for the people involved. Apart from that, very nice stay.

title: Never Again
review: How this hotel rates itself as a 4 star, I do not know.   We arrived on the 30th of October 2009. We booked a room with a King bed, as my infant daughter sleeps with us. When the bell boy opened the door to our room, I instantly thought I was in hell. It was old, it smelled like moth balls, the bathroom was mouldy, and to my terror, there were 2 single beds pushed together. The mattresses felt like they were at least 30 years old. I could feel the springs in my back. We were also placed directly above the part of the restaurant that plays live music till all hours of the night. The room reminded me of an old crappy motel room on any old highway you could imagine.   At 5.45am the next morning, after having exactly NO sleep at all, I called the manager. I told him of my problems.…

title: I'll Be Back!
review: A superb hotel that exceeded all expectations.  Clean, large and bright modern rooms, comfortable beds, hotel grounds to die for and a cost that can't be beat considering the amenities available.  We paid just over $100 Cdn/day total for 2 persons, 4th floor balcony room, airport pickup and return, incredible buffet breakfast daily and a one-hour massage and with all taxes and tips included.   Prices probably go up quite a bit in high season but we'll definitely be back in shoulder season...possibly as early as next year.  Friendly, attentive staff.  Can't comment on the bungalows though...we did not stay in them and I'm not sure that they would be worth any extra cost except as a romantic "extra".

title: Fantastic Hotel and location
review: Just read some recent reviews as we are thinking of booking again. Glad to see the hotel is still rated highly. When we went it was excellent, there is nothing at all negative to say about the hotel and the area in general. It is at the quieter end of Patong beach and in the road behind the hotel that runs parallel to beach road, there are so many open air eating places, where you can choose from the fish display and sit and watch your food being cooked. We hired a scooter and had a few days going around the island, out to Cape Panwa, Kata, Karon. All the beaches are lovely. The hotel pool and sunbathing areas are lovely, as was the breakfast buffet and the rooms. We regretted not booking a balcony room (didn't realize they didn't all have them), but preferred the actual hotel…

title: Fantastic time!!! Once Again
review: Have only just returned from another fun filled fantastic time at the club andaman. Once again they delivered on everything. Rooms were cleaned thoroughly every day, beds were huge and comfortable. Staff were happy to see us back again and went out of they're way to ensure that we were well taken care of. Pools were sparkling clean and inviting, never short of a pool lounge. Pool boys were very helpful and always keen for a game of soccer with the hotel guests. Gardens were lush, clean beautifully manicured everyday. Breakfast choice was  unbelievable, everything you could wish for, from fresh fruit, cereals, salads, bacon eggs and sausages, ommletes, asian foods, pancakes, cakes, muffins, croisants, breads and much much more. We were always greeted with a smile from reception…

title: Great hotel and great location
review: Hi All, We spent 2 nights in Andaman beach resort. After being upgraded in a Cottage, we had a greats stay. Staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean and well equipped (everything you need was there). All facilities were clean and accessible. The breakfast is fantastic with a large choices of foods. Location is perfect !! Nearby the beach (3min walking) without any sound from night life ;-))

title: enjoyable stay
review: This was our second visit to the hotel, staying 16 nights in a deluxe balcony room.  Again everything was great and we will be returning next year.  As per last visit, the lift doors close very quickly so you have to be fast entering and leaving the lift.   The staff are friendly, the breakfast buffet has extensive choice, the rooms are clean, the grounds and pool area are beautiful.  We highly recommend the ladies at Amazing Thai massage just outside the gates near the pool.

title: Fantastic Time
review: Just had 16 WONDERFUL days at Club Andaman, This was our fifth time staying at Club Andaman and it was once again FANTASTIC, The pools, staff, cocktails, breakfast, hotel room[we have stayed in the cottages twice] surroundings just SUPERB. It was quiet, not many tourists in Phuket at the moment, but everyone and everything FANTASTIC. We will be back next year. From Gemini, New Zealand

title: Delux room 624
review: We arrived to a very welcome cool drink, and a nice welcome smile. We checked in quick and was then shown to our room. As i had booked a delux room i was expecting a balcony. We didnt have one. we asked to change rooms but they had none at that time. After a few days we was shown one but decided to stay in our origanal one. The room was a very good size with great veiws. we were suplied with a bath robe and brolly, with i laughed at but it was needed. The grounds are amazing, so well kept. The bar by the pool does nice cocktails wich at certain times of the day are buy one get one free. You can one clean towel for pool use every day. Didnt use the spa as they are much cheaper just outside the gate. The sea is just outside the gate and accross the road. there is a little shop…

title: Think twice
review: I had some clients recently return from an 8 week stay at this resort and they didn't have anything good to say.  Firstly a double bed was requested, but they were given two single beds and when they complained all the staff did was push the beds together. They also had lice like bugs crawling in the bathroom, however that was the least of their problems. They had bites all over them from head to toe and when they arrived home and visited the doctor, they were advised they had scabies from bed bugs!!! That is not acceptable for a hotel.

title: Great palce for family holiday
review: Just spent 2 great weeks at this resort- I was a little concerned having read others reviews on Trip advisor but we found it to be a great place to stay. We had 2 interconnecting balcony deluxe rooms- they were clean and cool with  a great view of the sunset over the ocean. The corridors are dull but they have started a big paint job so that should help. The gardens are beautiful and the pools are big and clean. We found the staff very helpful  and friendly . We would stay here again

title: Perfect location, Perfect hotel
review: Just back from a 15 night stay in a bungalow room and all i can say is PERFECT. From the hotel staff who were all proffesional and friendly to the wonderful breakfasts to our lovely bungalow room all was perfect, even though our air con broke down on second day it was fixed within 30 minutes of reporting it to staff couldnt ask for better than that. Pools were perfect and location to beach was excellent and in my opinion best part of beach in patong. Had the opportunity to have the Songkran Buffet Dinner what a great night thank you for that. All in all a perfect holiday at a Perfect resort and i will definately be back.

title: Good
review: We have been 3 times to Phuket and decided to take our honeymoon there also, we had booked a bungalow,DONT do it, it was awful, (it smelt wet and it was down a back track which was very dodgy.) We asked for another room and were told we couldnt change  until the next day, i was soooo upset as this was our honeymoon and we had a horrible room for our first night, after pleading with staff we managed to get another room wich cost us an additional fortune. It was a lovely room but not worth the money. We ended up having  a great holiday. Be careful when booking, the rooms are very deceiving.

title: Never Again will we stay here
review: Just saw this site and thought id write a review of our stay last September.After reading some of the reviews i think you seriously need your head read if you think this is a good hotel.The place is run down,period!!! The place smells and the rooms are so outdated.Ive seen better rooms in a 600THB a night in Nana Plaza.Tell me if im wrong!!!! I was so annoyed with myself for picking this hotel and then seeing how good our friends were having it in Patong Merlin.I spoke to my travel agent about this and they have had many complaints about this place,so its not only me.

title: Relax at Club Andaman Beach Club
review: Stayed in a bungalow two years ago, and loved it. This year we chose a deluxe room with balcony. We got a warm welcome with cold towels and a drink. The rooms are standard, could do with some paint here and there to fresh up the look, but nice and clean. Nice view to the garden and the pools. I love the hotel and the facilites, large garden with two pools and the beach just across the street. The only down is the pooltowels and the chairs. They smell damp. Would I stay there again - yes! It's an oasis in the middle of busy Patong Beach.

title: Run-down
review: This was our second stay here. Unfortunately the hotel doesent seem to spend any money on room maintainance. We had a  Balcony Deluxe room again, the air-conditioner broke down 3 times during our 8 day stay. We were moved finally from a room with a King-size bed to a room with single beds. when I complained  I was assured it would be rectified the following morning, and it was, the 2 singles were pushed together, but still seperately sheeted. On check-out I asked for a refund for our last 2 nights, but received only our bar account to settle!

title: Abolutely perfect! Can't fault anything.
review: We stayed at Club Andaman for a week last September and was so impressed with everything including facilities, rooms, hotel grounds, the buffet breakfast and especially the service. After having travelled most of the world and staying in many different hotels, Club Andaman is definitely the best service I have ever received. The rooms were cleaned thoroughly everyday. The grounds are beautiful and away from the noise and traffic for a peaceful nights sleep. Still within walking distance to everything though. We are now planning another trip back this year and will be booking Club Andaman again.

title: Watch out for bed bugs!
review: We have just returned from a two week holiday to Hong Kong, Phuket and Bangkok.  We spent 5 nights at the Club Andaman Beach Resort which was very central to all the clubs, pubs restaurants ect but at the same time was set in large grounds so that it was quiet at night. When we arrived at the hotel we were shown to our room (211) which was disappointing following on from the room we had in Hong Kong and which was of the same 3 * rating. There was a peculiar smell in the room but when we went to open the window there was a swarm of insects outside so we had to close it quickly. The furniture and fittings looked used and damaged and we were looking out over a building site so there was noise during the day. However the worst was to come after returning from an excellant night out,…

title: Love the place
review: I am originally from Phuket and heard about the hotel for a long time and I always want to stay here (we are visiting Phuket every year). Many of my friends stayed at the hotel and they were very happy with the hotel; they said great for kids and family or even honeymooners. I decided to book for our stay last year. My mother-in-law who was unsteady on her feet at the time and she founds that she has no trouble with access in/out from the hotel. She was quite happy with the room, services and staff (and so did we).  We didn't have any trouble and our room is look over the gardens and pool.  There were many friends and family came in to pick us up at the hotel. Security guards were very helpful with parking etc.  Our rooms were very clean and the room gets clean every day. If it…

title: Never Again
review: We have been frequent visitors to Thailand and thought we would try Club Andaman on this visit. If there is ever a reason to not spend time in your room then this hotel is it.  After a long flight and another hour in the bus upon arrival i was told my room wasn't ready. I can understand this to a certain degree when you arrive at midday. When asked if there was somewhere i could have a wash they directed me to the gym. The showers there were not clean there were no doors and had 2 foot saloon doors seperating the showers from the gym.  After 4 hours i was checked in, it was a large and clean room but first impressions can be misleading as i was to find out. Everyday i had to phone housekeeping to have the room cleaned. There was constant maintenace throughout the hotel, not just…

title: Great Service & Brilliant Locataion
review: My 4 year old son & I stayed here for a week in Oct. We loved the hotel.  The pools, room service food & the staff were great. The buffet breakfast was fantastic! So much food! When you walk out behind the hotel swimming pools you are just across the road from the beach. There is a dairy, a bar, a pharmacy & lots of other shops on that road aswell. I loved Phuket & would definitly stay at Club Andaman again!

title: very average
review: The resort is old and needs a lot spent on maintenance however the gardens, bars and surrounds were very good. Very close to beach. Our room was not clean which was not a major issue but I stayed at the resort with my fiance who is a Thai national and she was treated very poorly. In fact the night security staff were quite insulting to her (including a man who I think was the night Manager) and we ended up leaving a day early. Their attitude and actions were totally unacceptable and we'll certainly never stay there again. I submitted similar comments on the resort's review form but have received no reply from the resort.

title: Had a great time - we'd go back...
review: We were two families of two adults and two children per family travelling together.  We had booked to stay at the Andaman Cottages (2 connecting rooms per family) but the rooms weren't available on arrival due to maintenance.  Luckily for us, Kay was on the case (lovely lady in Customer Service) and she managed to get us into the hotel with connecting rooms for one family and we were upgraded to the Royal Grand Suite for the first two nights!!  Very lovely...  We moved to the cottages only to find them damp and filled with mosquitos.  Later that day we asked to be moved back to the hotel and after much checking and deliberation, Kay (again!! thank you Kay) was able to help us out.  One of the pools had to be closed down for repair during our visit which was quite an…

title: Great location and hotel
review: We got a great hotel deal that ties in with the air tickets. Went there via Air Asia. I strongly suggest travellers to stay in Patong beach compare to other beaches because this beach is where every has lots and lots of shops and all the night life here is absolutely fabulous! Club Andaman Beach Resort is located in Patong beach and is just 5 mins (or less) walk  to the beach. It is hard to find hotels which their own private beaches in Patong but rest assured, the walk to the beach is extremely short and along the way, you'll get to pass by shops after shops. We enjoy this hotel because the location is great, the price we paid for the standard of the hotel is definitely worth it, room is big, bed is great, tv channels comes with many good channels such as the sports channels,…

title: Just had a perfect holiday
review: The hotel's location was perfect, just on the outskirts yet close enough to walk to Bangla Rd, shops, resturants & beach. The hotel was spotless & very good value for the cost. Staff were fabulous, really went out of their way to make our stay perfect, all were lovely, warm & so polite, couldn't ask for more. Breakfast had every selection you could want, the resturant meals were really nice & very reeasonable. We went off peak, so the area was comfortable to walk & get around. We will be back next year.

title: Awful
review: Just read Patrickaustralias reveiw of this hotel and noticed I did not do any reveiws form our Xmas trip. So I thought even though late I should do it now. This was the worst (and only bad experience) of our Dec/Jan trip. Unlike Patrick we started off in a bungalow. The A/C did not work, the bathroom was tiny and the rooms generally very very old outdated and not that clean. The noise was something else - we did not get to sleep before 5am as the music from the clubs was unbearable. There was also heaps of fireworks going off regularly all night. The next day we went to breakfast - which was awful (even though included in our rate we did not eat there again). I spoke to reception and the girl was very nice and said many people complain about the noise in the cottages. We were…

title: Had to upgrade!!!!
review: Where do i start? The moment you walk in the main building it has an old musky smell to it which put us off straight away. We went in the elevator which will close on you if your not quick enough, and went to our room. Going through the corridor, we looked around and saw very outdated decore, dirty carpets, no aircon in the building itself and still a musky smell.  We took a look at the room and demanded an upgrade. I was with my wife and 4 year old boy and the room was very outdated, the tv was small and wasnt pleasant at all. I know it was a standard room but even when shown a better room we still werent happy.  I had to upgrade to the bungalows outside just to escape the main building. Well,the first night the aircon didnt work. The next morning i rang reception to ask what…

title: Best Resort in Patong!
review: Stayed for 10 days and will be back again next year.  The service was faultless.  The rooms were clean and bright (who cares if the hallways are dull - you don't spend much time there!) The restaurant was great. Breakfast was the best meal of the day - there is nothing they don't have!  Cocktails and drinks at unbelievably low prices and happy hour at each bar makes it even better!  The pool area was magic and there is NO towel hire fee!  All staff were extremely polite and friendly and went way out of their way to make your stay the best it could be.   The grounds are a sight to behold and it makes for a little haven to return to after a hard day of shopping or sightseeing. The Amazing Thai Massage ladies in the Andaman Bazaar are the best in town and I can't wait till we…

title: Excellent value for money and delightful staff
review: We booked the Club Andaman through an airline package. At first glance we were a little disappointed in our choice as the corridors were rather dreary and the guestroom was a bit dated. Additionally we were given a twin room when a double had been requested. However, the bedding problem was fixed promptly.   In all other respects we were delighted with the Club Andaman. Our room was spotlessly clean each day courtesy of the housekeeping staff. The extensive grounds are lush and inviting and the pool area is excellent (but bring or buy some beach towels to avoid the excessive towel hire fees!).   The public areas are excellent. The lounge bar, in particular, is fantastic at night - providing wonderful views of the tastefully lit gardens. Drinks are reasonably priced and the…

title: Excellent hotel exellent staff
review: Two weeks in August 08. Room was fine even with 3 people staying there. The grounds and the staff all great plenty of room and it's location is opposite the beach so your close enough to everything but in a green oasis. Pool was always clean and there was never any shortage of sun beds.  The birthday cake was a nice suprise on the evening of my birthday and it these touches that make the hotel. the cleaning staff were very friendly and maintained the room to a more than acceptable standard.  A good hotel in a good location which is family friendly. thats what I wanted and that's what I got

title: Great value and location
review: We booked through Asia Rooms in the low season at unbelievably reasonable rate for good holiday resort.  Yes there are some negatives as you will read and some are valid but overall I would stay here again for its location  space and beautiful gardens. The room was really good it was large modern in perfect condition and fantastic views of Phuket.  The corridors were very ordinary.  The breaktast area is large and spacious overlooking beautifully manicured gardens. How good is that.  The lack of atmosphere has to rest on the staff as the hotel as all the ingredients of a perfect holiday. They all need retraining especially the reception staff.  But overall this place was worth a visit I enjoyed the 3 days.

title: Fantastic family value holiday
review: Brilliant holiday for family of 5 with teenage children- clean, comfortable and excellent location. A bit quirky but worth the money- Lovely grounds, friendly staff , breakfasts can get busy but worth the wait. Selectively picked a few hotel tours  (whitewater rafting) but mostly organised our own. Would highly recommend the night markets on saturday night in Phuket town ( about $10 cab fare , )the Koh Chang elephant sanctury and trek , no tour buses allowed and elephants well cared for, River Rovers tour for monkeys to feed on the boat and an authentic thai experience on a fish farm for lunch with Captain Gordon, and Para-sailing on Patong beach. Great value and a brilliant holiday !

title: LOVED IT
review: This was my 2nd time to Phuket, and loved it more this time than the first. I was a little worried at first about the hotel we were staying in after reading the reviews on this site... but I have no idea wat some people are complaining about.... We had an awesome time, I could not fault the hotel at all... everything was clean, the room was cleaned daily, the staff were friendly and the breakfast was amazing  Club Andaman is in a great location.. right across from the beach.. and walk outside the hotel grounds and there are restaurants and plenty of shops for plenty of shopping I would definately go back again!! Enjoy :)

title: Great View
review: Review might be a bit late but have only just found this site.  This was the 3rd time i have been to phuket and the last time i would stay at this hotel. If you are going to stay here may i suggest the 6th floor looking out over the ocean this was the only good thing about the place. There are cats all over the hotel, not my thing may be yours.  Ordered room service twice, the first time waited an hour, went to sleep. The 2nd time 45 minutes. The order was for a burger and chips i really wasn't being fussy.
