Restaurants were average as was the pool service even when there were only 8 or so guests around the pool they struggled to keep up.  Everything closes really early in the hotel and there is no vibe, culture or entertainment on offer.  For a 3 star it does have all the…

title: Great stay at the Andaman
review: We booked a 5 night stay at the Club Andaman after spending time in Nothern Thailand.  The hotel was excellent, there isn't anything that I could fault.  The location was great, the pool and outdoor area was fantastic, our room was lovely, great breakfast, friendly staff.  Would highly recommend.

title: Two words BED BUGS
review: The stay at Andaman was ok overall.  The first night i was sitting watching TV and i saw this bettel, I thought it was a bed bug but wasn't sure so asked my mum, she thought it was one two but didn't want to scare me so just killed it and said it was nothing.  Luckliy that night i felt asleep fast, however my mum did not. The bed bugs were on full march all night she spent the night killing them with a hand towel, by the morning it was covered in blood!  They changed our room twice, the first one had bed bugs as well then we got put on a different floor and checked the room but it was clean!  The rest of the stay was ok but i wouldn't go back!

title: Don not stay at this hotel!!!!
review: I am writing this review on behalf of my  mum and dad, they had such an awful experience they wanted me to let everyone know how awful this hotel is. My parents are worldwide travellers and have never experienced such an awful place.  Firstly the rooms are very tired and in need of upgrading however they could cope with that, however they could not deal with being set up and money taken from them. Prior to their trip my dad decided to upgrade their room as a treat to my mum, so he contacted the hotel to do so. They told him to pay they difference when they arrived. So after 24 hrs of travelling minus my poor mums case they willingly paid for the upgrade on arrival whilst checking in. However, my dad forgot to ask for a reciept! So when they were checking out the hotel asked them…

title: Good experience at the Andaman
review: We stayed at the Andaman for 6 nights in May 2008  Arrival procedure is lovely, you get a welcome drink and a cool towel - much needed for a May arrival!   Our room was slightly disappointing, as we had booked a double, and requested a renovated room. We received a twin, non-renovated. Beds were very hard also. But the rooms are big - which is great for longer stays.   Hallways and common areas were a little rundown - and very damp - but given the events in 2004 and the humidity here, its not really something to complain about, and it didnt really effect us in any way.  We ate at the restaurant heaps, and found the food to be wonderful. The breakfast is AMAZING! Anything you could imagine is there!  We also used the Booking Desk to book all of our excursions - and this was…

title: loved it
review: just recently back from phuket,we loved the hotel.Gardens were beautiful ,pool fantastic.Staff very friendly and helpful.ROOMS WERE VERY CLEAN AND SPACIOUS.(beds a little hard for me).Lobby bar staff were great altho dont expect more than 1 drink in happy hour (a bit slow then).We were a group of 8 adults and a 2yr old child and had no problems at all.We all had agreat time and would stay at the hotel again.

title: Great hotel with friendly service!!!
review: We just got back from Phuket and Bangkok for our second honeymoon,( i guess any excuse is great for a holiday). I was a little confused with some of the reviews from previous guests that stayed at club andaman. Being in customer service myself i know exactly what sort of people write these negative reviews, the whinging type that always require things on a silver platter. Do not get me wrong the whole purpose of this website is to help other holiday makers in choosing and booking the perfect holiday in which we all deserve at times. But to bag out a hotel from one or two bad experiences is just wrong! I have so much respect for the Thai people in the way they service you and the expression on their faces when you give them a tip, the way they still smile and thank you even when…

title: Disgusted with Front Office Staff
review: My wife and I checked in for our second honeymoon from 11th to 14th June at the supposed hotel with ISO ratings and a name for its friendliness and polite front staff. However, we experienced a totally unexpected reception from Day 2 of our stay.  Day 2 - enquired from Concierge about day tours and was told to get trips from the hotel rather than being advised to scout around the area for other deals. Good thing we did not heed their suggestion. Went round and managed to get a 8 hour day tour via taxi for 1600 Baht compared to the 1300 baht offer for a 5 hour day trip from the Concierge.  Day 3 - requested for late checkout on 14th June but was flatly rejected by the Front Office Receptionist by the name of "Da". She was very very reluctant to help and did not even allow us to…

title: Heaven
review: After staying at the South Karon Sea Hotel, we switched to Patong Beach Club Andaman on 31st dec 2006. After arriving by taxi we walked into reception and immediately knew we did the right thing by changing.  The place was beautiful and modern and the check in clerks were all very nice and helpful. After getting our room key we went to our Bungalows which was awesome! it had such an original feel, I loved the room and the bed, but there needed to be more lighting in the bathroom but overall the room was amazing!!  After that we explore the area a little and took a dip in the pools... great pool and was told that the new years dinner wasnt on our list when we paid for the hotel at home so we made our own plans and glad, we had an awesome time at Fantasea for NYEs... The next…

title: Loved The Large Grounds and Pool area
review: Recently had 8 nights Club Andaman Beach Resort, enjoyed the stay immensely, staff were lovely resort clean and large outdoor  area, beautiful garden, two big pools one very deep which most young children didn't use, good for adults enjoying the pool.  The resort is a little older than some but is well maintained and rooms air conditioned and recently painted.  Also liked the fact that it was one of the last hotels along the road, close enough to the hustle and bustle of Patong,  but a little quieter at that end of the street.  Close to the beach, coming from Australia I thought the beach at Patong a bit ordinary but enjoyed the stay.  If you are a person that likes to stay  in a new resort the Andaman isn't for you, if you like comfort cleanliness and service it is great.

title: loved it
review: My husband & I (left our 2 year old at home) had a fantastic, relaxing holiday. Booked accom on AsiaRooms.com which saved us alot compared to travel agent.  On check in at 4pm our room wasn't ready due to a late check out so we were given a temporary room. We were called at 7pm & moved to our Balcony Delux room number 522. Our room was great. Clean, king bed, fantastic balcony with views through the tops of the trees to the ocean. The staff we encounted at the Andaman were always friendly & helpful. Buffet breakie was great. We got room service for lunch 4 times & each time the food came quickly & was yummy from the burgers to the Thai dishes. The 2 pools were refreshing, large & clean. The location was great.  There are two night clubs located at the bottom of the resort…

title: Club andaman , all good!!
review: My wife and two young children (3 and 2) stayed at the Club Andaman for 10 days and loved it! Grounds were awesome for the kids as they had heaps of room to kick a footy and run around etc. Pools were very good and plenty of deck chairs. There is also a toddlers pool which is only about 30 cm deep. 7/11 is right out the front as well as a money-changer and atm. 5 minute stroll to Bangla rd and jungcelyon. Rooms could do with a spruce up but otherwise all good. Only thing is all normal rooms do not have a balcony, If you want a balcony room its extra. If you want to stay in a cabin ......... Club Lime (doof doof) on the beach road, kicks on untill the early hours. You have been warned.....

title: wouldnt go again
review: we have been 1 week at the Club Andaman Beach resort. The room was ok, but nothing special.We tried to get a bungalow but all overbooked. The breakfast was good, we didn´t try any restaurant at the  hotel because you have so many restaurants outside. The staff was unfriendly especially at the reception.we had some problems there, because we made a small Henna Tatoo and the sheet of the bed got a little dirty. The reception told us, that we had to pay the sheet. Never happened to us, but ok, we were willing to pay it. when they told us that it costs 60 euros I felt abused.I dont think ,that a thin cotton sheet costs 60 Euros, especially not in Thailand. We paid it, but I didnt like the attitude of the people at the reception. The Hotel has a beautiful garden and the pools are…

title: Good Location and Ok hotel
review: We spent a week here in the middle of March as part of our 3 week honeymoon.   We stayed at this resort because of its good location in Patong and reasonable reviews on this site.  Generally we were happy with our room (balcony on 6th floor) but would say that the hotel is in need of internal decoration.  The main reception, entrance and external appearance is good, but the lifts, corridors etc are a bit tired now.  Air con in our room was very dated and not very effecient and also having to put the key in the wall to get Air Con on meant the room was always very hot , and when it was on it was noisey and not effective.  Breakfast was very good and the choice was excellent - but dont arrive after 10am cause the service will be poor and you wont be offered coffee refils etc as…

title: Surprise by the service
review: We have just returned from 4 days at the Club Andaman Resort,Phuket. Is a very good experience when my wife and I first look at our bed which is decorated so nicely that we never experience before . We are so impressed that the staff really took their time on decorating the bed with the beautiful flower and also the fruits that provided in a nice decorated boat.Secondly , when we stay on the second day, we are so surprised by the cake that put on our table that saying "Happy birthday, Mr.Tan" because 2 April is my birthday.This is again the first time I had been great by a hotel that know my birthday.Well done!  The location of the hotel is very convenient that the beach is just situated across the road.Even the hotel have two exit that one to the beach,shop and restaurant…

title: Great Resort for Familes
review: We were a family of 5 (three young kids), on our last stop of our holiday around Thailand. When we first arrived, we had a bit of a hicup when we were told that there were no interconnecting balcony rooms available (which we had booked for). Thankfully the staff found us connecting rooms in the bungalos, so we were able to be reallocated with very little fuss.  Note: If you are booking interconnecting rooms, be aware there there are not very many available and you could be left without any choice but to take seperate rooms. The breakfasts were great with a huge range available and the lunches around the pool were very satisfying.  The staff were very friendly and always eager to help if you needed anything. The resort grounds were imaculate and the pools were always clean and…

title: Poor Customer relations
review: I had a terrible experience at the hotel. The first impressions were good, but when away from reception I found the hallways hot and unclean. When in my room, it was extremely hot. I left the air con on perminantly and the room temperature.only owered to 85 degrees during the day and 80 degrees in the midle of the night. Even after a shower, I was immediately sweating. Speaking to other guests they report the same issues  There are many nicer hotels at cheaper prices than this one

title: Good family resort
review: My husband, 4-year-old son and I had a wonderfully relaxing 4 nights in this resort. The room was good, but more importantly my son loved the pools and the beach was just a few minutes' walk from the room. We didn't bother with the kids club - didn't really need to as Luke has so much fun in the pool. We had breakfast at the resort, which was good, but no other meals. As other reviewers have said there is a great seafood market at night nearby, and in the same area we found a place for lunch where all the locals go which was very basic, but cheap and yummy. There's lots of touristy places to eat on the beachfront if that's more your scene.  After reading the TripAdvisor reviews I booked a balcony deluxe room. We could hear the nightclub, but it wasn't loud enough to stop us…

title: A Little Piece of Paradise
review: While at club andaman we stayed in a hotel room with balcony. The room was clean and roomy for my husband and myself. The bathroom was a little dated but clean. The staff were always friendly and attentive to all our needs, they always said good morning and made us feel very relaxed. Breakfast was always lovely and there was always plenty of food and choices.  We booked a couple of day trips with the tour desk at the hotel and tour desk staff were always very friendly and tried to get us the best deal. The amenities were great. The pools were clean and tidy and pool staff were there to attend to our requirements without being in your face. We did a fruit carving class whilst staying at resort and the staff were very helpful (as I was hopeless in carving fruit). The grounds of…

title: Great choice
review: Pleasantly surprised on arrival - we stayed in the lotus rooms around the pond - at first our room was close to the laundry and a bit noisy but we were soon moved to one more quiet. Two lovely pools and a smallish sunbathing area. Good varied choice at breakfast. Our stay included Chinese New Year and Valentines night and the restaurant staff had an excellent themed meal for each occasion. The gardens were beautifully decked out and a lot of attention paid to small details. Rooms clean and tidy - not opulent. Walk out of the hotel onto the promenade and beach and you are at the edge of tourist Patong - close enough to walk everywhere but not too busy. Hotel massages expensive compared to the multitude of choice on the streets. Constant happy hour at Club Lime right by the hotel.…

title: great place to stay
review: Great holiday resort, rooms are a good size with all normal amenities, lovely 2 pools, loads of subathing areas, spa/poolside massage etc  Only ate in the restaurant for breakfast which was good, is right in the centre of Patong so step just outside and you have a huge choice of restaurants/shops etc  Is a 2 minute walk to Patong beach, literally just cross the road and your there.  You can hear music from your room at night but it wasn't loud and didn't bother us/keep us awake at all.  Nice friendly staff, would stay here again.

title: This place is wonderful
review: So I have been meaning to write a review for ages and never got around to it. But given I found this site and the reviews of fellow travellers so helpful I have finally decided to bite to bullet and write something.  We stayed at Club Andaman last year in May and had a trully amazing time. When we initially booked we booked 8 days at Club Andaman Patong and a further 8 days at the Kata Thani down south in Kata Noi. The Kata Thani was about 4 times the price of Club Andaman and the whole time we were at Kata Thani we wanted to go back to Club Andaman. Ok so the room itself isn't amazing, its clean and is a great layout, its actually fairly big compared to a lot of places in Phuket, the bed is perfect, balcony great however you have to accept its not 5 star...... But who cares, we…

title: great location,for beach,lovely gardens
review: Lovely friendly staff who were helpful and always smiled and said hello to you. We stayed in one of the bungalos and found the room clean and comfortable. Very thai,and could do with an update would not suit fussy people who like 5star. Ajoining door to the bungalo next door failed to stop noise if people in this room became noisy. Our neighbours in this room were fantastic and we ended up going out to dinner with them We had two seats and a table outside our room and found this to be a nice place to sit and have a drink after a hard days shopping. It was about a 1 minute walk to the pools through the beautiful grounds. Both pools ,clean,with very friendly staff in attendance The buffet brecky was a good variety and we ate here every morning over 10 days. If you get a chance…

title: Damp and dismal, old and musty!
review: Ok we had been staying at the Dream in Bangkok for a couple of days which was fantastic, cheap only £52 a night with expedia, comfy, big rooms, plasma tv, funky and fun. We then moved into this place. What a total letdown. It was just at the end of the monsoon season, we arrived in a cloudy but warm Phuket, arrived to a warm greeting from the helpful staff. Checked in and went up to our room, a balcony room on the 2nd floor. As we walked down the long corridor to the room the smell of damp musty air welcomed us, as well as the mosquitos flying around in the corridor! As we rounded the corner to our room, the smell and the mosquitos source was identified, the roof was leaking and had been leaking for some time, the carpet was wet, the ceiling was black with mould. As for first…

title: Very Dissappointing
review: We have not long returned from our 2nd trip to Phuket. Last time we stayed at Patong Merling & loved it, but were unable to get in as we booked at the last minute. Our travel agent reccomended this one too us, we looked on the website and it looked ok, and we were just desperate to get to Phuket again so went ahead with the booking.   Upon arrival, we requested adjioning rooms, or at the least rooms close to each other, in the same corridoor & also with a balcony so we could enjoy the warm nights. We were told there were none of these rooms available, and the room we were booked into was not ready. We were told to go have some dinner in the buffet & when we returned our rooms would be ready. The lady who was checking us in was very hard to understand, and her english was limited…

title: My wife called it a 'Government' Hotel :-)
review: Just back from 8 days at the Club Andaman.  The Hotel was OK.  Location was quite good, being set back from the beach about 200 metres.  Easy walk through the garden and across the road to the beach.  The guy running the deckchair concession on the beach who we nicknamed 'somchai' was really great.  Easily regonised as he damaged his left arm in a motobike accident.   Hotel staff were the main problem.  Not that helpful and a bit beaurocratic, hence the 'Government' Hotel term.  Not sure I would stay there again.

title: 10 days at The Club
review: We had a great 10 days at the Club Andaman. Check in was fast and efficient. We had originally booked to say in one of the Cottages - we even requested a cottage far away from the nite clubs near the resort, even still the music was too loud to sleep and we could hear talking from all the other cottage inhabitants nearby by when they got home after a big night. The cottages were well kept - if a little old and needing a spruce up.  After 2 nights we had enough and requested a move to the main tower. We moved into a room without balcony on the 6th floor and it was both larger and newer in fit out. The bed was huge and very comfortable and the room had sea views and over Patong. Breakfast was a real treat with a range of foods including those great Thai eggs, sushi, salad, stir…

title: Great place to stay
review: We had a wonderful stay at Club Andaman from Sept. 25 to Oct.5.  Initially had 2 cottages but one smelt quite musty so moved to the balcony rooms at an additional cost.   It was well worth it.  Had 10 nights there and would definitely go back.  The staff were very friendly and anything asked for was not a problem.  The breakfasts were superb.  The pools were great.  Room service was very prompt and food really nice.  The only thing to note was a lot of noise from the neighboring clubs which went to quite late at night.  It did not worry us but did bother some people in the cottages.  Our teenagers enjoyed the free internet and happy hour for cocktails.

title: Great Resort, Friendly and Helpful Staff
review: We were originally staying in the Grand Tropicana Hotel, but our agent organised for us to move due to reported outbreaks of legionaries disease :(. This resort was absolutely fantastic. The staff were always friendly and helpful. The check-in was most pleasant, they gave us a welcome drink whilst we waited, and were very efficient with the whole procedure. We couldn't believe our luck when we got there as the Grand Tropicana was terrible with staff that did not want to know you. So as it was we were not expecting much and were more than pleasantly surprised. Thoroughly recommend to families and couples who want peace and quiet, but also want to be able to walk to the great surrounding restaurants and busy night-life area within Patong beach. It is very peaceful and secluded…

title: Great hotel, friendly staff
review: My husband and I stayed there for 4 nights, it's great.  The staff are very friendly, room is spacious and clean.  I love the breakfast, lots of choices.  We had a traditional Thai massage at their Spa, very relax and professional.  The location is good, it's north of the busy area, but still within walking distance.  The only thing is the table cloth at the restaurant (during breakfast) and room furniture are old, doesn't look like a 4 stars hotel.  Also, they charge premium for their airport shuttle, you'll find much cheaper taxi to airport around the block outside the hotel.

title: Great Hotel
review: Due to renovations at our original hotel, our agent could only get us into Club Andaman.  As it turned out this hotel was far superior than we expected.  A couple of little hiccups at checking in but nothing to spoil the stay.  We had a balcony room on the 4th floor.  Next time I would go a little higher so I can see over the trees.  Nevertheless the room was large, comfortable & clean.  Bathroom was spotless with toiletries left every day.  Locality wise, was walking distance to shopping, restaurants etc.  Breakfast was exceptional and the staff were friendly.  Pools were so inviting.  Noticed that children were catered for as well.  No hesitation in recommending Club Andaman to anyone visiting Phuket.

title: A top spot for a relaxing get-away...
review: My extended family and I have just returned from a very enjoyable and relaxing stay in Phuket, thanks to Club Andaman Beach Resort.  We stayed for 8 nights and loved every minute of it!   As we only booked 6 weeks prior to our departure date we had limited accommodation options available, which was a little concerning as we were traveling with a young child (15 months).  The other thing that worried us was that when we approached a couple of travel agents regarding their packages to Thailand, each agency had VERY different views about suitable accommodation for a large family (6 adults) and an infant..  Some agents told us that the Club Andaman Beach Resort was a very busy hotel, popular with young party goers, and far too noisy for a baby.  Thankfully we decided to listen to a…

title: Idyllic grounds
review: Stayed 10 nights in late June 2007 after spending 10 nights at the Patong Merlin overall preferred The Club Andaman as more upmarket.Have stayed there twice before and will return again, because of this they gave us a free tranfer from The Hotel Merlin.Great location large idyllic grounds beach is just over the road and the huge new Mall Jungceylon is only 10 minutes walk away.We stayed in Balcony room had view over grounds and beach very relaxing with huge comfy king size bed.Staff were very friendly.Great Buffet breakfast but cats where annoying hanging around your table and stray dogs where roaming around the grounds. The other gripe was the two tread mills in the fitness centre where broken down when we complained on numerous occasions we were just fobbed off . These were…

title: Could not Fault this Hotel
review: We stayed here 5th - 19th August 2007 and it was everything we could have wished for.  We were greeted upon arrival with an ice cold fruit drink as well as a basket of fresh fruit.  The location is great and is within easy walking distance to the shops, markets, nightlife and beach. The complex has two lovely outdoor pools, complete with lots of sun loungers and umbrellas and a nice bright kids area.  We had room 522 which is at the end of the wing, facing the sea and overlooking the beautiful garden area.  These rooms have a huge balcony which is partially covered over and complete with outdoor chairs and a table. The staff are really polite and courteous and nothing is too much trouble for them. I would definately recommend this hotel to all age groups and will most certainly…

title: Perfect Resort
review: Just experienced the wonderful hospitality of Club Andaman. This is the third time that we have stayed ther and it is perfect for families and couples alike. The staff are so efficient ,friendly and eager to please. The breakfasts were delicious with a wide choice and the night entertainment was most enjoyable. I would certainly not look past the resort for future stays in Phuket and highly recommend it for a relaxing and stress free holiday.

title: Excellent Resort
review: We stayed in the Bungalows and they had everything we needed. Breakfast was awesome, so many choices could not be faulted. Everyone was so friendly and helpful.  The location is great easy walking distance to shopping and night life or 100 baht for a tuk tuk to bangla road. The grounds are beautiful very lush.  Will definately stay there again next year. Great Holiday Shirl and Shane WEst Aust........

title: aussies with 2 boys, loved the hotel.
review: We holidayed last november and the kids ( 6&8 ) are giving us a hard time about going back & i realised that  i had neglected to enter my opinion of this absolutely fantastic hotel.  After our travel agent failed to find us accomodation at any of the regular hotels that were popular for their kids club, I found Club Andaman on the net and were able to book interconnecting rooms at about half the price of the others!  We stayed for 2 weeks, one in hotel, one in cottages ( as no availability in cottages during first week) Both were great but cottages were better for us as we didn't have to drag the boys through the foyer all wet after being at the pool every second day.     The service was exceptional and staff loved the kids to bits! The included buffet breakfast was also…

title: Club Andaman Beach Resort. Very Friendly
review: We have stayed here now four times in two years. The staff are fantastic and very friendly. You should try the Anda Spa, my wife has a massage every day because the staff are so friendly and for the quality of the massages.  It is always pleasing to be remembered when you return. The variety for breakfast is great. You are always served with a smile no matter what time of day or night. We have stayed in the main building, the Lotus village and the cottages. We do not recommend staying in the cottages anymore. The music from the bar and restaurant directly out the front of the resort is very annoying. They play loud music to very early in the morning. It is the only negative experience we have had at this resort. We recommend the Lotus Village because you can hardly here the…

title: Amazing. Good for all age groups, couples and families
review: I am from Sydney, Australia and stayed at the Club Andaman for 8 nights with my wife and her sister for a holiday. I have been to Fiji and Bali and let me tell you that this was one of the best resorts and Country to visit. The people are friendly, the food is great and the shopping...excellent!!! At arrival we were given a complementry drink which was very refreshing. The whole 8 days had beautiful weather as it was raining heavily a few days before we got there. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Yes there is sometimes a communication barrier as a few could not speak english but its not something that should bother you. If you have any problems just call front desk. Half our room lights stopped working and the airconditioner wasnt working properly but one phone call and 5…

title: Wonderful 3 days in Phuket Patong Beach
review: Location Club Andaman Beach Resort is on a very large property, on 10 acres of garden (according to its website). The hotel’s reception end is at Rat-U-Thit Rd, and the pool end is at Thaweewong Rd (Patong Beach).  Location is at north end of Patong beach, next to the Nike shop.   Rates Andaman Room on 4th floor, 3 adults, 3 nights, THB2675/night nett incl. breakfast and extra bed, booked through Asiarooms.com.    Reception Speedy check-in at a separate aircon area off the main lobby (non-aircon). While waiting, we were served hot towels, drinks. There were several Japanese staff, so no problems with speaking English or Japanese.  Room At 4th floor, there were renovations near elevators, a bit of dust, but not much noise. King bed and extra bed were all prepared before check-in.…

title: loved the andaman
review: Club Andaman Beach Resort Patong Beach Phuket Thailand. Trip advisor member.Auckland. New Zealand Four of us spent two weeks at the Andaman in 2 cottages and had a fantastic time. The hotel is across the road from the beach and also has two fabulous pools, as well as one for children.It is close enough to the busy Patong shopping area and nightlife,but far enough away to be quiet.There is a restaurant close with a live band, but this seemed to stop by about 11pm, except for one night.The staff are friendly and obliging and the rooms are clean and comfortable. There is also a spa on site and some shops, as well as restaurants if you feel like eating at the hotel. We will definitely be staying again on our next trip to Phuket.

title: Great Location - Useless Check in
review: On booking the hotel room online in January 2007, I had specifically requested for a quiet room and a baby cot. A week before, I even emailed the hotel to ask for the quiet room and baby cot. I received an email from them saying they will try.  On check-in, we noticed that all other checking in guests were given drinks and towels, we were only given towels but no drinks. So strike one.  When we checked into the room, the first thing we noticed was the small size of the room, the second thing was the lack of a baby cot the third was the adjoining door, through which we could heard the TV from the next room, so much for a quiet room. Strike 2.  The next thing I noticed was the lack of drinking water in the room, we say the little tags for the complimentry water, but no water. I…

title: Club Andaman Patong Was OK but
review: My family of 5, 2 adults and 2 teenagers stayed here April 2007. We found arrival very good booking in was easy and friendly. We found the Village cottages very nice the rooms are big and have nice bathrooms. They even give you bug spray for you room. The breakfast was very good great choice nice staff. The gym was a bit of a let down as half the gear was broken, the guy in the gym was not friendly and he did put the table tennis table up for us but the ball were rubbish as were the bats but we were on holiday so no big deal. We did feel that the pools were small and crowded and not enough chairs. The restaurant by the pool was good value and sold ice creams at good prices. When we asked about the cooking school and Thai language class we were told that they both were not…

title: Peaceful and tropical place to stay
review: Our family of four have recently returned from 7 nights staying in adjoining Andaman cottages.  We got through check in quickly enough and were escorted to our adjoining Andaman cottages staight away.  Our first impression of the cottages were not that good.  Both the bedroom and bathroom were extremely small and ours were squashed between other rows of cottages.  Unfortunately for us, the front row cottages (nearest the pools) were all full.  Once we got over the shock and went exploring though, we discovered a tropical oasis in the middle of bustling Patong.  The gardens are truly magnificent!  We actually enjoyed being in the cottages after a while as we were a lot closer to the pools and grounds and not all the rooms in the main buildings had balconies.  The breakfasts were…

title: Great Place to Stay
review: April 11th - 19th 2007 We have just returned from 8 nights at Club Andaman.. and found it to be just right for our needs. It was walking distance to all shopping and night spots in the Patong area..  The rooms were clean and spacious enough - we had an end room which gave us two windows - one a bay window to the street along the side and the other our balcony which looked out over the magnificient garden and pool area and beach just through the trees.  We found the breakfast to be terrific with plenty to choose from and staff very efficient - the guy cooking the eggs had a smile on his face all the time.. really nice chap. The pool area was nice - although we found that by the time we were ready to relax there were quite a few about so we opted to find a nice quiet spot on the…

title: Good But Not Great
review: We stayed here for 2 weeks in march for our honeymoon, we were supposed to be upgraded as part of our honeymoon package but this never happened. The room was quite small and the bed extremely uncomfortable, we could feel the springs through the mattress so woke every morning with sore back. The internet facilities barely ever work but there are plenty of internet cafe's close by and much cheaper. If you want quiet nights then don't stay here as you can here the music from the andaman bazaar at the back of the hotel until 1:30am very annoying. The grounds are lovely pool is great and staff are so friendly, breakfast choice is great. The location of the hotel is great short stroll to Bangla Rd. All up our stay was fine but i think you could find better.

title: Good place but seriously overpriced
review: We arrived here on feb 21st and stayed 11 days. The rooms are clean and spacious, just make sure that you close the wooden blinds in the loo otherwise the person in the bedroom has a birdseye view! We paid € 1,450. through ebookers and it was way too much for a 3 star hotel.If we had booked directly we would have saved approx €350. Book early to get a much better hotel for a lot less money. The staff were nice and breakfasts fine. The grounds are very lovely, an oasis in the hustle bustle of Patong. There is quite a lot of construction ongoing in the area.

title: Perfect for family
review: The resort is beautiful, the staff is good and the location and pools are excellent. The resort is perfect for those who travel with family.  You should take the tour which goes to all the must seen islands in one day. Don't waste your time, neither your money looking for tours outside the resort.We did it and we ended finding out that it's cheaper and safer buying the tickets at the resort desk tour. Don't rent jet skiis on the beach.It's dangerous and they don't have insurance. Outside the resort, there are many restaurants.We found a very cheap and good italian one one block from the resort. Leaving the resort facing the beach, you go left and turn in the first street to the left, it's the only italian one on the left side, about 50 meters before you get to the next traffic…

title: Love this place!
review: My husband and I stayed here for four days in January.  We didn't want to leave, and we are not even beach vacation people!  The staff was uniformly friendly and charming, especially the tour guide coordinator, the room was large and cleaned every morning (I hate coming back from an excursion exhausted and having to wait for the room to be cleaned -- this was not an issue at Club Andaman), and the grounds were simply gorgeous and tropical.  There was a mother cat and her kittens on the grounds that were very amusing to watch, at least for cat lovers like us.  The Andaspa was also great - we got a scrub, wrap and one hour massage for two for about $78 US.  The only negative is that we did not particularly care for the food at breakfast, which was included.  It was a very good…

title: Good service & location, but very noisy at night
review: I and my wife stayed in the suites for 5 days.  Room is a bit old but clean and tidy, breakfast is ok. Swimming pools are great.  This was the first time we stayed in this resort, we were very happy until at night. The music is too noisy and it is coming from their open restaurant. It Start around 9:00 pm until 1:00 am. It is too noisy that we couldn't sleep. Even though you are watching tv and you can still hear the noise, bom bom bom.... We complained to the hotel and they only replied was to relay our complain to the restaurant. There was no improvement for the rest of the days. Only the pool view and sea view rooms will hear the noise. I think that this is the only problem we had in this resort. I won't stay there again unless they make improvement.

title: The Tailor is good value too
review: This was our first trip to Phuket (July 2006) and we enjoyed a relaxing holiday in the sun.  The Tailor in the main part of the Hotel made a dinner suit for our 16 year old son to wear to the school ball.  We were so impressed with the quality that my husband and I both ended up getting suits made and my husband got 10 shirts as well.  All up this cost around 26000 bhat or approximately NZ $1100.  The service provided by John the Tailor and his staff was excellent and all done in about 3 days.  As for the Hotel, we preferred to stay in the Bure's.  The only downside to holidaying in Thailand (in general) is that you can never access an iron and ironing board and seem to have to pay someone to do it for you.  Club Andaman is in an excellent location.  Handy enough to be an easy…

title: great place to stay
review: After 13 years we finally went back to phuket after going to bali year after year. we did not know what to expect especially after the tsunami. Well there is no trace of the tsunami. Phuket is clean and you can walk on the footpaths with out fear of falling down a sewer hole... Club Andaman beach hotel was a first stay for us and we are so glad of our choice. Airport arrival was smooth and swift (not like bali where you are getting ripped off left right and centre by someone trying to make a quick buck) that doesnt happen at phuket airport... arrival at andaman was quick and we were in our rooms swiftly. We stayed in the andaman cottages, we had three rooms. Kids loved the hotel and soon were able to walk around the hotel with ease. Brekkie was great and the restaurants had…

title: Great price for a great resort :)
review: We staying at the Club Andaman in October which was supposed to be rainy season and we only received a little rain in 2 out of the 5 days we were there which was great.   The resort is great for a 4 star resort. Although it seems to be ageing in parts, it is kept clean and tasteful.  The service is excellent and they are wonderful with the kids. I went with another family and my 3 year old daughter and 5 month old son and they had such a good time. The staff remember your name from check in and are very accomodating.   The facilities for the children are great. I was surprised to see a review stating that they were disappointed there wasn't a seperate pool for the kids. They do have a little kiddie pool just off the main pools which is something you don't always find in resorts.…

title: Amazing holiday loved every minute!
review: Just got back from a fabulous 10 night stay at Club Andaman. In short we loved the hotel and loved Phuket.  The room was spacious and the bathroom was nice - as stated in a previous review - it is odd that they have a window between the room and the bathroom with blinds on the outside so the person in the bathroom cant close them if need be - this wasn’t a problem for us but if you are not intimate with the person that you are sharing with it may be awkward.  The service in the hotel was great, on one occasion they forgot to leave a bath towel in the room so we phoned housekeeping and practically before we had replaced the receiver there was a knock at the door and warm towels were delivered.  The hotel has 2 pools which were not crowded; we usually had a secluded half to…

title: Going back for seconds....
review: My husband and i had a 14 day stay at club anderman sept 2005, we were so impressed as soon as we returned to australia, we invited to take my parents back this year.  The staff, services and food were beautiful and we look forward to our return to share this experience with my parents. 4 weeks to go and we will be lazing next to that amazing pool. squizz :)

title: Second time around
review: My partner and I made our second visit to Club Andaman in July and we were not disappointed. Once again the staff were lovely,  always friendly and happy. It was nice that some rememberred us from last year.  The grounds were immaculate and the recreational facilities were very enjoyable. Once again we had a balcony room, this time on the 6th floor. We had a terrific view over the hotel gardens towards the sea. It is worth the extra few dollars to have the balcony.  We again took advantage of the on-site tailor shop and can recommend them for anybody requiring suits ,shirts, blouses etc. if you are after an inexpensive and good quality massage then go see the ladies at the massage hut near the pool.  Club Andaman is ideally located. A comfortable stroll from the action at Bangla…

title: It is not a resort, it is a Heaven !!
review: My wife and I stayed there 4 nights, it was (litrally) a natural reserve !! It has a huge green field with a pond in the middle. The restaurant is beside that area and open to it (to the extent where you see birds drinking from the milk on your table), and the two pools and the cottages are surrounding this area too.   Our room was a balcony room on the 5th floor with a spectacular view, it was spacious and clean. All staff were friendly, with a basic English. They try there best to help even without a tip, but when ever they can't, they don't have anything called the extra mile even with a tip.

title: Great Location
review: Great Hotel, We were booked into a cottage and when we garrived there we were not happy with the first cottage they showed us, only because the porch area was only a few feet from the cottages in front of us, no air flow, very cramped.   We ask to see a room in main building but were not happy with this room as well, small and very tired looking, it was also raining at time and flooded balcony area.   They showed us another cottage which was great, nothing in front of us just gardens etc and the pool, the room number was 016 any of the 3 cottages in that block are good, also had friends in 034 (I think)which was also good area.   Cottages have everything we wanted eg room safe, tea coffee facilities. Staff are great, pool is lovely and the grounds are beautiful We are pretty…

title: where's the world renown thai hospitality? not at club andaman
review: cross the road and you're at the beach, walk down the street and there's a host of seafood eateries so location is good. size of their andaman room is decent with a huge bed emperor size bed. clean room with competent housekeeping. however, on the whole, it's a nondescript resort with indifferent service that relies on tourists who book with tour agencies on packages. they won't be getting return visit from me. they can do better. so can we.

title: Paradise in Patong
review: We travelled from London, as a young professional couple.  What can we say?   After a indifferent time in Bangkok, we entered Phuket and the Club Andaman resort with mixed expectations, unaware of what was to lay ahead. From the minute we entered the reception of the Club Andaman resort until the minute we left, I can only exlpain the experience as nothing short of magnificent. The customer service is embarrassing. They will go to the end of the world for you.  We stayed in an Andaman Cottage. They were spotless, and the maid arrived daily to spruce the place up after our mess. We were 10 seconds walk from both the pools.  The grounds are a world in themselves, a place you could spend your holiday without going outside the resort.  I cannot recommend this resort high enough to…

title: Target - Relaxing!
review: After extensive research through the internet, and this fine search model..TripAdvisor. I setteled on Club Andamon Beach Resort for a 14 day stay. After the very long trip from Australia and spending 2 hectic days in Bangkok, I arrived at Club Andamon - tired and ready to relax. Booking in at Reception was an easy process, with the staff making great effort to have themselves understood in their lilting English. I had booked ahead a 'balcony' room', on account of liking my privacey, when escorted to my room - one look through the doorway sent me into purring raptures, here was the most glorious gardens, the Andaman Sea & Patong Beach spread out in front of me, from the 6th floor. What a great start! I was in Phuket to relax from a busy, manic work schedule. I didn't come to see…

title: All right but there is better in Patong
review: I stayed in a little bungalow which was cute but fell short of my expectations. It was clean but the furniture and decorations was quite ordinary. You can find better in the same price range. Staff was friendly and helpful -- this is Thailand after all! Grounds are beautiful. The hotel charges an annoying joinder fee. The gym is a bit of a joke.

title: THE BEST Our family can't wait to return
review: We have travelled extensively through the world and Club Andaman Beach Resort would have to rate all round as the best resort we have ever stayed in. We spent only a week there Sept. 04 and were determined to return for a longer stay.  Returning again this year in September and the whole family very excited (2 parents + have 2 teenage daughters and a 10 year old son  ACCOMMODATION: We have stayed in both the hotel rooms (sea views) and the Lotus Garden Bungalows. Both accommodations were immaculate, large, all facilities (inroom safe, satellite TV etc.)Our families preference tho' were the bungalows right near the pool, breakfast, and set right amongst massive tropical gardens. Very peaceful, quiet and relaxing.  We had interconnecting rooms in both the hotel and bungalows …

title: Right on the beach, nice but nothing special
review: I had a "bungalow" which was clean and okay, nothing fancy though, and 5 other bungalows were attached, not standing alone.  I booked the hotels because it had two nice pools and it was next to the beach, right across the street. Breakfast buffet is huge and if you are staying in a hotel room in the main house you have the impression you are staying in a city hotel, nice big lobby. Many Japanese tourists. Would probably not go back because the guest houses i have seen where much cheaper and also had everything I would need. Now after the big sea quake I doubt that the hotel is still operating. No idea.
